fields.title: About RunMyCode
fields.content:
The RunMyCode website is operated by a not-profit making scientific association called the RunMyCode Association. The mission of the Association is to make research in economics and business easier to use and easier to replicate. RunMyCode is currently funded by several national research agencies and universities.

fields.title: Terms of Use
fields.content:
PLEASE REVIEW BEFORE USING THIS WEBSITE - IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THESE TERMS OF USE, DO NOT USE THIS WEBSITE.

General Description

Welcome to the RunMyCode website. The RunMyCode website is operated by a not-profit making scientific association called the RunMyCode Association (the “RMCA”). The mission of RMCA is to make research in economics and business easier to use and easier to replicate.

The services provided by the RunMyCode website (collectively the "Services") are:

(i)
to allow researchers (the “Coders”) to create companion websites associated with their scientific publications (articles and working papers). A companion website is a website allowing people to run the computer codes associated with a scientific publication;
(ii)
to allow users (the “Users”) to implement researchers’ methodologies using their companion websites. All the calculations are made on a dedicated cloud computer and, once ready, the results are displayed to the users.

These Terms of Use contain ground rules for your use of the Services (the "Terms"). By accessing, using, or contributing to the Services, you agree to abide by the Terms.

RMCA may change the Terms from time to time, at RMCA's sole discretion. Your continued use of this website following the posting of such changes will constitute your assent to all such changes. Please periodically visit this section of the website to review the current version of the Terms.

Use

The Services are provided solely for personal, non-commercial use. You may not take any material from this website and reformat, repost, or redisplay it for commercial purpose. You may not reformat, repost, or redisplay any material from this website for non-commercial purposes provided however that:

(i)
you may redisplay the title, author(s), coder(s), and/or abstract for an individual companion website included in the RunMyCode online library, together with a link to that document's public abstract page on RunMyCode;
(ii)
you may cite or quote individual RunMyCode usage statistics, rankings, citations, and similar information with acknowledgment of the source, date, and URL for this information.

Content

Contributed content should be relevant to the subject scope of RunMyCode. Content may not be illegal, obscene, defamatory, threatening, infringing of intellectual property rights, invasive of privacy or otherwise injurious or objectionable. RunMyCode has the right (though not the obligation) to remove, without notice, any content posted which we consider, for any reason, to violate these Terms or to be outside the subject scope of the Services. RunMyCode may terminate any account, with or without notice, for posting such content.

Copyright

Any person who provides any material for inclusion on RunMyCode is responsible for ensuring that this material does not violate other parties' copyright or other proprietary rights and does not otherwise violate law or applicable RunMyCode policy. As part of its general right to remove material, RMCA reserves the right in its sole discretion to delete or make inaccessible files that do or may contain material that violates law, or applicable RunMyCode policy, or the rights of third parties.

License

By contributing content to RunMyCode, Coders grant RMCA a non-exclusive, royalty-free, perpetual, worldwide, revocable license to use their content in connection with the Services, including, without limitation, the rights to execute, copy, distribute, transmit, publicly display, print, allow others to print, publicly perform, reproduce, edit, translate, and reformat your digital and non-digital content, and/or to incorporate it into a collective work.

Ownership and Rights

All materials on RunMyCode are the copyright of RMCA or are reproduced with permission from other copyright owners. All rights are reserved. The materials on this website may be retrieved and downloaded solely for personal non-commercial use. No materials may otherwise be copied, modified, published, broadcast or otherwise distributed. RunMyCode is a registered trademark.

Accounts

To utilize the Services, or certain portions thereof, you may be required to complete a registration and submission process and establish a RunMyCode account ("RunMyCode Account"). You represent and warrant that all information provided by you is current, accurate, and complete, and that you will maintain the accuracy and completeness of this information on a prompt, timely basis.

Security

As a registered user of RunMyCode, you may receive or establish one or more passwords. You are solely responsible for maintaining the confidentiality and security of your password(s) and RunMyCode Account(s). You understand and agree that you are fully responsible for all actions and postings made from your RunMyCode Account(s). Any accounts you have created are not transferrable. You agree to notify RunMyCode immediately if you become aware of any unauthorized use of your RunMyCode Account(s).

Termination

RMCA reserves the right to terminate your RunMyCode Account or restrict access to your RunMyCode Account, or to delete any content posted through your RunMyCode Account, with or without notice, for any or for no reason.

RMCA disclaims all responsibility and liability for the availability, timeliness, security or reliability of the Services. RMCA reserves the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue the Services or access to the Services without any notice at any time and without any liability to you.

Disclaimer of Warranty and Limitation of Liabilities

RunMyCode is provided on an “as is” and “as available” basis. RMCA makes no representations or warranties of any kind, express or implied, as to the website’s operation or the information content or materials included on this website. RMCA assumes no responsibility for the accuracy, suitability, or completeness of any content provided. RMCA will not be liable for any damages of any kind arising from the use of, or inability to use, this website. You expressly agree that you use this website solely at your own risk.

Updated 01-17-2012

fields.title: Privacy Policy
fields.content:
PLEASE REVIEW BEFORE USING THIS WEBSITE - IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THIS PRIVACY POLICY, DO NOT USE THIS WEBSITE.

General Description

The RunMyCode website is operated by a not-profit making scientific association called the RunMyCode Association (the “RMCA”). This privacy policy sets out how RMCA uses and protects any information that you give when you use this website. RMCA is committed to ensuring that your privacy is protected and that information will only be used in accordance with this privacy statement.

RMCA may change its privacy policy from time to time by updating this page. You should check this page from time to time to ensure that you are happy with any changes. This policy is effective from January 1, 2012.

Information We Collect

As with many websites, we collect certain information, even when you are not logged in. When you browse, read, download information, or run codes on the RunMyCode website, data is collected, including but not limited to your IP address, URL request, browser type, and date and time of your request.

We collect the IP addresses of visitors, time of access, browser type, and web pages visited. We also collect information on which companion websites an individual user access and use. We do not collect any other information without your knowledge and permission.

Personal Information You Provide

RunMyCode requests personally identifiable information when you register for a RunMyCode account or when you create a companion website – including information about co-coders. Such information may be used or requested to perform research, improve usability of the website, administer mailing lists or online communities, or other activities related to RunMyCode services. This information may include, but is not limited to, personal names, email addresses, location, title, and affiliation.

Codes You Provide

RunMyCode is a computer code sharing platform. If they want, coders can prevent their codes from being downloaded by other users. This specific information must be provided during the code submission process.

Data You Provide

There are several types of data submitted to the website:

  1. Demo data provided by the coders to illustrate and test a companion website can be freely accessed by any user of the website.
  2. Own data (either historical, proprietary, or simulated) used to run a particular companion website are systematically anonymized by our system and cannot be accessed by other users.

Results You Produce

When a user uses a companion website with her own data, she produces a new set of results. These results are stored for the convenience of this particular user in her personal account (see “Past Results” section of the User Control Panel). This set of results cannot be accessed by other users.

Cookies

Anonymous users may receive session cookies while visiting our website while their browser is open. Registered users have user accounts and are subject to the RunMyCode Terms of Use. Registered users receive session cookies when they are signed into our site. To facilitate our registration and sign-in functions, we may use cookies to recognize when you return to our website. If you do not delete them, these cookies allow us to keep track of your username and password so that you do not have to resubmit the information to sign into your account. If others will be using your computer, you should sign out of your account and delete any cookies so that your sign-in information is cleared.

Security

This site has security measures in place to protect the loss, misuse and alteration of the information under our control. However, your confidential use of this site cannot be guaranteed by RMCA. RMCA shall not be responsible for any harm that you or any person may suffer as a result of a breach of confidentiality in respect to your use of RunMyCode.

Updated 01-20-2012
